basics.name: Samantha Mallari
basics.label: Undergraduate Student
basics.summary: Aloha mai kakou! I am currently an undergraduate studying Computer Science in the ICS Department at UH Manoa in the combined Bachelor's and Master's pathway. I expect to receive my B.S. in Spring, 2025 and my M.S. in Spring, 2026.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Manoa, HI
University of Hawaii at Manoa, Manoa, HI

work.company: UH Manoa College of Social Sciences
highlights: Supervised Mac and PC computer labs, provided technological assistance for students and instructors, acting as a bridge between the IT department and the students and instructors in the classroom
Troubleshoot various technologies, improving resolution times and strengthened interpersonal skills

work.company: UH Manoa College of Natural Sciences
work.summary: Internship as part of ICS 390 Computer Ethics for Lab Assistants
highlights: Assisted students in the lab portion of ICS 111: Intro to Computer Science
Developed and delivered a 1-week lesson plan to enhance student understanding and engagement, reinforcing foundational computer science concepts using Java
Held office hours and strengthened communication and teaching skills by presenting complex topics in diverse, accessible ways
Learned foundations for video game and app development
Developed a platformer game and presented it to peers and industry professionals
Collaborated with peers to develop storyboards and game mechanics

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Awarded to students who earn a GPA of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade during a semester.

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded annually for being a Hawaii resident with a high school cumulative GPA of 3.6 or higher.

awards.title: First place - Detector Building
awards.summary: Built a salinity probe using prototype materials. See portfolio site for more details.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: Built a mobile application for team scouting at VEX Robotics competitions. See portfolio site for more details.
